subject: Make dowload provider run properly with multi-user and on 64 bit architecture
commitMessage:
Make dowload provider run properly with multi-user and on 64 bit architecture

bug fixes:
 - get smack fs path from smack API
 - use int type with ioctl FIONREAD to get correct values on both 64 and 32 bits arches
 - fixed wrong usage of smack_new_label_from_socket
 - moved management of default destination to CAPI in order to run the code
with user privileges
 - removed code trying to guess remaining disk space because it only checked an
unreachable, hard coded folder instead of real destination. The case when the disk
is full is already handled at writing time.
 - added dependency on net-config (in specfile) because DP can't work properly
without it.

Bug-Tizen: TC-1415

Regards,

subject: [FIX] buffer overflow in download-provider.
commitMessage:
[FIX] buffer overflow in download-provider.

when building SQL queries, allocate one more byte to account for the
separator char *and* the termination nul byte.

subject: clean up spec file
commitMessage:
clean up spec file

- properly use ldconfig for the shared libraries
- remove rm -rf %buildroot in %install section
- add smack manifest file in devel package
- change group tag
- remove useless post requires
- use systemd macros on post/preun/postun sections
- use %license macro
- remove '_smackruledir' and '_licensedir' macros definitions
- use fdupes to reduce few rpmlint warnings on locale files

Change-Id: Ie85734f410c8c245d5feac1474ad8f66fa4a0e5e
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Remove SMACK rule file(.rule) according three domain model
commitMessage:
Remove SMACK rule file(.rule) according three domain model

Since SMACK only allows three labels, "_"(floor), "User", "System"
The labels of current rule file are not appropriate 

Solution:
- Remove rule file (download-provider.rule)
- Remove install statement about installing rule file described in CMakeLists.txt
- Remove file path and name declaration of spec file (packaging/download-provider.spec)

Reference site
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Security:SmackThreeDomainModel


Change-Id: I7116f08b2869cdb361baf72871ff6e555e70bbbb
Signed-off-by: seong.chung <seong.chung@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Please separate the other patch for db script.

And this patch has no problem to build package ?

It seems that libtzplatform-config can not support any header file yet. (platform/core/appfw/tizen-platform-config)

If that package have not been finished to release yet, I cannot review and verify this.

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 1:

The header file is in the package /platform/core/appfw/tizen-platform-wrapper

libtzplatform-config is created with the tizen-platform-wrapper which generates c code and header file

You can find more explanation in the wiki page discribing the packages.
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Multi-user_Architecture

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

jungki kwak: the header files in tizen-platform-config are generated during build. You can check the resulting header files using the RPM binary.

For example in Tizen:Generic: http://download.tizen.org/snapshots/tizen/generic/generic-wayland-x86_64/latest/repos/generic/x86_64/packages/x86_64/libtzplatform-config-devel-1.0-4.1.x86_64.rpm

or here in rd-pq snapshots:
http://download.tizen.org/snapshots/tizen/rd-pq/latest/repos/mobile/armv7l/packages/armv7l/libtzplatform-config-devel-1.0-5.1.armv7l.rpm

Patch Set 1:

Other packages also call system() directly. With a quick grep, I found:

platform/core/messaging/msg-service
platform/framework/native/appfw
platform/framework/native/installer
platform/framework/native/uifw
platform/framework/web/webkit-efl
platform/framework/web/wrt-commons
platform/framework/web/wrt-installer
platform/framework/web/wrt-plugins-tizen

subject: Fix: coredump if invoke pthread_* with NULL thread handler
commitMessage:
Fix: coredump if invoke pthread_* with NULL thread handler

This coredump can be triggered if download-provider request the
well-known dbus name failed, for example, currently, there is no dbus
policy conf for download-provider, so dbus daemon will reject its
request.

Bug: https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TDIST-276
Change-Id: Id341aa7da19bc89085bd5909391a37dde19b0173
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

Gerrit system don't like it.

will upload v3

(1 comment)

For the Verified +1, I just means I did verified my change, and I think every developer should do that. So the reviewer, especially maintainer who will do "+2", know that the change passed test.

Generally an engineer do not add "+1 Verified" in owner patch In Samsung.
If it is permitted in Intel side, that is okay.
I think it is the difference of coding style.
Thank you.

subject: add dbus policy conf file
commitMessage:
add dbus policy conf file

This patch permits root user to own 'org.download-provider' bus name.
In addition it adds a "send_destination" rule to allow traffic to this service.

Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2045 and TIVI-1629

Change-Id: I625f9dfd9626edbafb0832aa39c6879186d7ba4c
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@eurogiciel.fr>

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project devel:ivi: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Patch Set 1: Verified-1 Code-Review-1

(1 comment)
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project devel:ivi: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I'm fine with this patch.

However, download-provider.service needs to be moved to systemd system session. That means from /usr/lib/systemd/user/ to /usr/lib/systemd/system/

Currently, if download-provider started by systemd user session, then it running with 'app' privilege, if download-provider activated by dbus, then it running with 'root' privilege.

And due to dbus policy, the download-provider in 'app' can not own its name.

There are already codes in tizen 2.2 which moved downloader-provider to systemd system session. I hope a samsung maintainer could help to sync the code from tizen 2.2, see bug https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/PTREL-64

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

I agree with you, 
download-prodiver fails if it launched as app even if we change the dbus rule to allow app user instead of root user.

There no need to have two ways to launch download-provider. ie systemd / dbus .
As I see, in Tizen 2.2, dbus launches was removed

As Kwangmin Bang set previously +2 on first patch.
We can conciderate to submit this and fix systemd script.

Samsung Team will merge Tizen 2.2 changes .

Change could not be merged because of a missing dependency.

The following changes must also be submitted:

* I16e4855569d2899e35a5a5620668dc8b0767c410

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
